solution_line_template: Adam can make {basswood_blocks} x {figurines_per_basswood} = <<{basswood_blocks}*{figurines_per_basswood}={basswood_figurines}>>{basswood_figurines} figurines out of the blocks of basswood.
He can also make {figurines_per_basswood} x {aspen_multiplier} = <<{figurines_per_basswood}*{aspen_multiplier}={figurines_per_aspen}>>{figurines_per_aspen} figurines out of a block of Aspen wood.
So, he can make {aspen_blocks} x {figurines_per_aspen} = <<{aspen_blocks}*{figurines_per_aspen}={aspen_figurines}>>{aspen_figurines} figurines out of all the blocks of Aspen wood.

He can also make {butternut_blocks} x {figurines_per_butternut} = <<{butternut_blocks}*{figurines_per_butternut}={butternut_figurines}>>{butternut_figurines} figurines out of all the blocks of butternut wood.

Therefore, Adam can make a total of {aspen_figurines} + {butternut_figurines} + {basswood_figurines} = <<{aspen_figurines}+{butternut_figurines}+{basswood_figurines}={total_figurines}>>{total_figurines} figurines using all the blocks of wood.
